sentences.sContent: He got into his car and drove off.
sentences.sCn: 他上了车，随即开车走了。

sentences.sContent: Will someone switch the radio off?
...This has wiped 6% off the value of the soft tissue paper market in the UK...
...You can’t turn off that stream of memories...
...Students who put off their work until the last moment often find the exams more difficult than they actually are...
...No one knows how new spin off technology from the international space station will help us in the future...
...Sleeping better may help fight off illness...
...But I get off the phone pretty quickly when I call...
...I can just lock up and take off early...
...went off and founded two other companies...
...it will die off with the generation who read print newspapers...
...I did what any professional writer would do; I hurried off to spread thegood news...

phrases.pCn: [英国俚语]从头开始；从起点开始，从一开始

words.tran: 冷漠的；不亲热的；疏远的
